aud.description: Audience of the token, indicating the intended recipient, e.g., https://graph.microsoft.com for Microsoft Graph.

iss.description: Issuer of the token, e.g., https://sts.windows.net/{tenant_id}/, representing a Microsoft security token service (STS).

iat.description: Issued At, the date when the token was issued.

nbf.description: Not Before, the date from which the token becomes valid.

exp.description: Expiration, the date when the token expires.

aio.description: Azure internal opaque value containing information about the token.

scp.description: Scope of the token, listing the permissions granted.

acr.description: Authentication Context Class Reference, indicating the level of authentication assurance.

amr.description: Authentication Methods Reference, listing the methods used, e.g., pwd (password), mfa (multi-factor authentication).

family_name.description: Family name (last name) of the user.

given_name.description: Given name (first name) of the user.

oid.description: Object ID of the user in Azure AD.

signin_state.description: Sign-in state, e.g., kmsi (Keep Me Signed In).

ipaddr.description: IP address from which the authentication was performed.

sub.description: Subject of the token, a unique value assigned to the user.

unique_name.description: Unique name of the user, often the email address.

upn.description: User Principal Name of the user.

app_displayname.description: Display name of the application using the token.

appid.description: Application ID of the app requesting the token.

tid.description: Tenant ID representing the Azure AD tenant.

tenant_region_scope.description: Tenant region, e.g., EU for Europe.

appidacr.description: Authentication context reference for the application.

platf.description: The platform from which the request is initiated, e.g., Windows, Android.

puid.description: A unique ID used by Microsoft Passport.

rh.description: An opaque value used to track and manage refresh tokens.

spn.description: Service Principal Name related to the application.

uti.description: Unique identifier for the token, used for diagnostics.

ver.description: The version of the issued token, typically indicating the token format.

xms_dlr.description: Information about the directory lookup result, e.g., a flag indicating a specific lookup outcome.

xms_tpl.description: Tenant policy information, often relating to conditional access policies.

xms_tcdt.description: The timestamp at which the token cache was deleted or expired.

xms_tbrh.description: Reference handle for token binding, used for security purposes.

xms_tdbr.description: Binary result associated with the token decryption.

wids.description: List of well-known security identifiers for client applications.

xms_idrel.description: Indicates the relationship or delegation of identity, typically used in certain authentication contexts.

onprem_sid.description: Security identifier (SID) of the on-premises user, used in hybrid identity scenarios.

acct.description: Indicates the account status, e.g., 0 for active.

idtyp.description: type of token (app, user, device). By default its only emitted for app-only tokens.
